item.title: SoftBank’s Masayoshi Son chases Nvidia
item.description: Also: Meta takes censorship memo from X, Nvidia trounces competitors in market cap, optimism about M&A.

item.title: Samsung warns its inability to meet demand for AI chips will make fourth-quarter profits fall sharply
item.description: The announcement comes after the world's largest memory-chip maker issued a rare apology in October acknowledging it was facing a "crisis".

item.title: U.K. launches a £10 entry fee for U.S., Canadian and Australian visitors
item.description: The scheme is similar to the ESTA system in the U.S. where visitors who do not need a visa must still apply and pay for pre-travel authorisation.

item.title: Texas legislature to consider tough AI bill, but critics warn it threatens to ‘stall’ U.S. AI progress
item.description: The Texas Responsible AI Governance Act (TRAIGA), also known as HB 1709, will be the next battleground for U.S. AI policy.

item.title: Flying taxis are ‘just a few steps from the finish line’
item.description: CEO of Joby Aviation, JoeBen Bevirt is getting closer to turning his boyhood flights of fancy into a dream come true.
